subject: PE Today: Baghdad Media Battle
body:
CBSNews.com













Lara 
      Logan RespondsOn Wednesday, Public Eye spotlighted CBS 
      Evening News Chief Foreign Correspondent Lara Logan’s report about 
      US soldiers rescuing two dozen starving special-needs orphans in 
      Baghdad. With an Iraqi leader publicly 
      questioning the segment, PE reached out to Logan to get her side of 
      the story.[+ Read More]



Paying for 
      Access?NBC News is disputing a report that the 
      network is paying Paris Hilton for her first interview after she is 
      released from jail -- inciting another 
      round of discussion about the the integrity of "checkbook journalism."  
      Public Eye asks: Why don't they just pay for these soft news 
      interviews and then disclose that they've done so to their audience? 
      Wouldn't that ultimately be more journalistically honest?
[+ Read More]



President 
      Bush, Fashion Plate?Of all the things for which you 
      can legitimately criticize Pres. Bush, should his footwear be among 
      them? With a news report 
      questioning the sartorial choices of President Bush, CBS 
      White House Correspondent 
      Mark Knoller bets a closet of shoes and a drawer full of socks that 
      Pres. Bush doesn’t care one bit about what someone in the press thinks of 
      his biking footwear.[+ Read More]
